item.title: Pedestrian crossing phase glitches, 10th January
item.description:
Sometimes, the traffic lights at the triangle junction between Gloucester Road and Lansdown Road "forget" that the button has been pressed to request a pedestrian phase. I.e. the "wait" indicator lights after the button is pressed, but then turns off without a pedestrian phase happening. Pressing it again usually leads to a subsequent pedestrian phase as usual in the cycle. Please could you look at this? Specifically this is on the North side of the A40, on the east-west crossing across B4633 Gloucester Road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gloucester Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
